abstract: “Amnesty recognises that the police have a duty to protect the public and themselves from harm, but we’ve got serious concerns about the use of Tasers becoming the norm for day-to-day policing."

abstract: JUDGES QUASH REPORT WHICH CLEARED OFFICERS A REPORT clearing police officers of any serious wrongdoing after the death of a man shortly after being Tasered has been overturned by the High Court. In the first case of its kind, two judges quashed the Independent Police Complaints Commission report on Jordan Begley at the request of the IPCC itself.
title: New inquiry into Taser death after decision is overturned

abstract: There are calls for all officers in England and Wales to be issued with Tasers after attacks on police.

abstract: In light of the recent death of George Floyd in the USA following Police restraint and the UK chief of Police and the Government both stating public solidarity with the family, The Justice For Marc Cole and Adrian McDonald campaign are now asking, How many more UK victims have to die as a result of Police restraint before our Government take it seriously?
title: Call on Government to Save Lives Revise Police training on the use of Taser Electrocution

abstract: The X26, Taser’s most powerful stun gun, was removed from the sales lineup in 2014. Behind the phase-out, a truth: The popular weapon posed a higher cardiac risk than other models.
title: More power, more risk and a quiet exit for Taser’s best-selling product
The rules of engagement: a review of the August 2011 disorders

abstract: Police officers have been put on restricted duties after an inquest jury ruled they were "more concerned with their own welfare" than a man who died after being Tasered by an officer. Jordon Begley, 23, was shot with the 50,000 volt stun gun and hit with "distraction strikes" while being restrained and handcuffed by three armed officers from Greater Manchester Police (GMP). He died in hospital around two hours later.
title: Taser death officers 'restricted'
IOPC calls for greater scrutiny of Taser use following increasing concerns | Independent Office for Police Conduct
IPCC review of Taser complaints and incidents 2004-2013

abstract:
The inquest heard how 32-year-old Andrew Pimlott had doused himself in petrol before a police officer fired a Taser at him. A fire erupted, engulfing Mr Pimlott in flames. He died a few days later from complications from the burn injuries he sustained.

The jury returned a narrative verdict, saying they felt the Taser was the most likely source of ignition. They also said that they did not know whether Mr Pimlott was holding a match at the time, as was claimed by the police officer involved.
title: Inquest jury concludes police taser is most likely cause of death of Andrew Pimlott

abstract: 28 January 2020
title: Inquest finds use of Taser by Devon and Cornwall Police contributed to death of Marc Cole when experiencing paranoia

abstract:
A man with learning disabilities was tasered eight times by a Greater Manchester Police officer.

Michael Gilchrist suffered catastrophic psychological injuries after he was repeatedly hit with stun guns.

Michael's mother says police saw her son as nothing - ''just another black lad from a council estate.''

He was also doused with pepper spray despite officers knowing he had mental health issues.

There has been no apology yet from GMP.
title: Man with Autism Tasered eight times by police

abstract: A POLICE watchdog has been granted a judicial review to quash its own report into the death of Jordan Begley , who was tasered by officers two hours earlier. The unprecedented move by the Independent Police Complaints Commission (IPCC) comes after criticism of the Greater Manchester Police during an inquest last year. In their report of the incident, the IPCC cleared GMP of blame.
title: Stun gun death under review
Tasers: ‘If officers have a new toy, they like using it’

abstract: Howard Swarray, 41, is set to challenge the verdict of the Independent Police Complaints Commission which ruled the cops ‘did not breach force policy.’ Mr Swarray, from Whalley Range, was working out at the Powerleague gym on Wilbraham Road when he had a seizure.
title: Dad ‘disgusted’ as cops cleared of wrongdoing after they used Taser on him during epileptic fit
